name: vscode-indent-on-paste
description: Re-indents pasted code to match the destination

indentOnPaste.endingBlocks.description: Pasting into a position followed by a line starting with one of these ending blocks will cause a (likely correct) extra indentation. Whitespace is stripped out when examining lines for end blocks.

indentOnPaste.pasteMethod.description: The method used to insert text when pasting. "native" (the default) uses VS Code's built-in paste method--retaining functionality such as "editor.formatOnPaste" and "editor.autoIndent". "workaround" completely bypasses VS Code's built-in paste method by inserting text directly into the active document, and can be used if you experience conflicts with other pasting functionality (might also be a little faster). A known issue with "workaround" prevents pasting outside the active editor, such as into the command pallete or search fields (use CTRL+SHIFT+V as a workaround).
